nodes.text: Muuns were a thin, tall humanoid species who ran the InterGalactic Banking Clan. Senator Rush Clovis was raised by a family of Muuns. They constructed their empire high amidst snowy mountain peaks.

The Muuns were a tall, pale humanoid species, known commonly across the galaxy as greed-driven bankers. The species' elongated skulls added to their height. Muuns hairless heads featured small eyes over a long, shallow nose, often giving them nasally speech. Their small ears were also flat, and were found underneath their skullcap. Their thin arms were of normal length, featuring five-digit hands. The last two fingers of their hands were much shorter than the others. Underneath their slim waist were a pair of very long, thin legs. They were a very intelligent species, known to have incredible mathematical capabilities. This was especially utilized in the management of the InterGalactic Banking Clan.

During the Clone Wars, the Muuns controlled the IGBC as both the Galactic Republic and the Confederacy of Independent Systems spent large amounts of credits on soldiers for the war. Nix Card as well the human Rush Clovis spent time representing the organization in the Galactic Senate. Clovis became the head of the IGBC after their ruling body, the Core Five, were arrested for corruption. Clovis was backed by Mak Plain, but was killed during the Invasion of Scipio. San Hill was a Muun who was Chairman of the IGBC and also served on the Separatist Council until his death at the end of the war.
